AIA Articles.Article_Name: Boeing eyes Brazil for rising SAF production
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Boeing's Landon Loomis says Brazil's sustainable aviation industry could grow into a major global supplier. "Brazil has the technical capacity, qualified workforce and raw material to post the concrete results and impacts needed for us to solve together this global challenge of how to decarbonize aviation," he said.

Leidos CEO Tom Bell is refining the defense technology firm's overarching vision, termed the "North Star," to address inefficiencies and duplication within its portfolio. Under Bell's leadership, the company aims to streamline its organizational structure, enhance decision-making speed, and better align its business with technological capabilities.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: MDA Next-Gen Interceptor approaches prelim design review
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: The Missile Defense Agency's Next-Generation Interceptor development is approaching a significant milestone, with two competing teams set to undergo a preliminary design review by the end of the year. The teams, Northrop Grumman in collaboration with Raytheon Technologies and Lockheed Martin partnered with Aerojet Rocketdyne, are working on a successor to the Ground-based Midcourse Defense system's Ground-Based Interceptors.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: BBN, Two Six tapped for DARPA supply chain program
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Two Six Technologies and the Raytheon Technologies' BBN unit for the Resilient Supply-and-Demand Network program. This initiative, led by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, aims to protect the US military supply chain from intentional or accidental disruptions.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Raytheon uses rapid prototyping in AAM development
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Raytheon Technologies, with its Pratt & Whitney and Collins Aerospace businesses, is using the Scalable Turboelectric Powertrain Technology demonstrator program for rapid prototyping of distributed propulsion concepts suitable for advanced air mobility. The program targets the development of high voltage distributed turbo-electric hybrid-electric propulsion concepts.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Airlines, government move toward air taxi operations
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: United Airlines intends to employ Archer's Midnight air taxi to ferry passengers from Manhattan to Newark Liberty International Airport. Blade Air Mobility, meanwhile, has teamed up with Urban Movement Labs to incorporate air taxis into Los Angeles's aerial transportation system. Both Virgin Atlantic and Vertical Aerospace are part of the UK's Advanced Mobility Ecosystem Consortium.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: How the federal government is taking a new look at data
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: The federal government has ordered that its agencies store and deploy data more efficiently, requiring creative solutions, says Chris Townsend, a sales executive at Elastic. Specifically, Townsend cites Department of Defense's idea "of being able to take the analytics in the search to the data, where the data resides, across all these different silos, and then bring just the relevant information back to a centralized location."
